cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest and expected to turn northwest then north toward the southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana or the Mississippi coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Indian Pass FL to Ochlockonee River FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Mississippi/Alabama border to Indian Pass FL; Hurricane Warning from Morgan City LA to Mississippi/Alabama border (incl. Lake Pontchartrain & New Orleans)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may bring gusts 20–30 mph, but sustained tropical-storm winds are unlikely at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for west-central Florida; forecast surge zone begins well north of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional outer bands could add 1–3 inches of rain across west-central Florida, including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the west-central Florida coast.
